plugins.name: Spagett!
plugins.description:
Spagett is here to spook you! Get ready to see Spagett everywhere.

When executing the plugin there's two possible scenarios:

1. Some layers is selected: Spagett will be added as a fill to every selected layer.
2. No layer is selected: Spagett will be added as a fill to every layer that already has a fill in the page.

(Some context https://youtu.be/uyh3C1xDT3Y)

The code for this plugin is open sourced at GitHub
https://github.com/aarongarciah/figma-spagett

Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è by Aar√≥n Garc√≠a
https://twitter.com/aarongarciah

plugins.name: Tokens Studio Tree Inspector
plugins.description:
Transform your Tokens Studio workflow with comprehensive token inspection. This Dev Mode plugin shows all design tokens applied to selected elements AND their nested children in one structured tree view.


üåü Key Benefits:

‚Ä¢ Complete Coverage - See tokens for entire component hierarchies, not just individual elements

‚Ä¢ Automation Ready - CSS-like output perfect for scripts and AI prompts

‚Ä¢ Time Saving - No more element-by-element inspection

‚Ä¢ Developer Friendly - Bridge design tokens to code implementation


üéØ Perfect for teams who:

- Use Tokens Studio for design system management

- Want to automate component development

- Need comprehensive token auditing

- Build design-to-code automation tools


Simply select any element in Dev Mode and get a complete token breakdown ready for your automation workflows.


Requires Figma files with Tokens Studio tokens applied.
plugins.tagline: See every Tokens Studio token in component tree hierarchies. Built for automation.

plugins.name: Iconic - Pixel Perfect Icons
plugins.description:
Iconic brings premium, ‚Äúdo wtf you want with‚Äù pixel-perfect icons right into Figma, making your design process seamless. With over 1400 icons available, you can find exactly what you need for any project‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs a sleek UI element or a fun emoji. We add new icons every week, so there‚Äôs always something fresh to work with.


The plugin lets you search and copy icons as SVGs with ease or directly embed them onto your canvas, saving you time and hassle. It‚Äôs a simple way to enhance your designs without breaking your flow in Figma.


Pro icons require a paid subscription through iconic.app.

plugins.name: Spacing Manager
plugins.description:
Spacing Manager is a powerful yet intuitive plugin for Figma designed to help you efficiently find and update spacing values in your designs. Whether you want to align elements to your design system variables or apply custom spacing, Spacing Manager streamlines the process, saving you time and ensuring consistency across your projects.


‚ú® Key Features:

üîç Quickly search for elements with specific spacing values.

üìè Replace spacing values with predefined design system variables or custom values.

üåô Interactive UI with smooth dark mode and gradient accents for an enhanced user experience.

üöÄ Seamless integration with your Figma projects, no setup required.


Take control of your design system spacing and ensure pixel-perfect alignment with Spacing Manager
plugins.tagline: Simplify and standardize your spacing with easy

plugins.name: Figaro Design System Token
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin for Exporting Variables


This Figma plugin simplifies the export of design variables (such as colors, typography, and dimensions) into a structured JSON format. It's ideal for design and development teams aiming to maintain consistency between their Figma design system and codebase.


With this plugin, you can export local variables organized into collections, including details about modes, aliases, and default values, making it easy to integrate them into development workflows like creating design tokens or style systems in CSS or JavaScript.


Features:


Export color, typography, spacing, and more from Figma to JSON.

Support for variable collections and modes (e.g., dark/light mode).

Alias management for consistent use of styles across projects.

Easy integration with development tools to use exported variables in web or mobile projects.

This plugin helps you maintain a robust and scalable design system, seamlessly syncing design variables between Figma and your code.
plugins.tagline: Export Collection Variables

102567.name: Figaro Design System Token
102567.description:
Figma Plugin for Exporting Variables


This Figma plugin simplifies the export of design variables (such as colors, typography, and dimensions) into a structured JSON format. It's ideal for design and development teams aiming to maintain consistency between their Figma design system and codebase.


With this plugin, you can export local variables organized into collections, including details about modes, aliases, and default values, making it easy to integrate them into development workflows like creating design tokens or style systems in CSS or JavaScript.


Features:


Export color, typography, spacing, and more from Figma to JSON.

Support for variable collections and modes (e.g., dark/light mode).

Alias management for consistent use of styles across projects.

Easy integration with development tools to use exported variables in web or mobile projects.

This plugin helps you maintain a robust and scalable design system, seamlessly syncing design variables between Figma and your code.

plugins.name: Cloudinary
plugins.description:
Enhance team collaboration, streamline your workflows, and leverage Cloudinary‚Äôs powerful media management features for your Figma assets.

The Cloudinary plugin integrates directly within Figma, allowing users to effortlessly insert images from the Cloudinary Media Library and upload images to Figma to share with others.


To get started:

  1. Sign up for a free Cloudinary account.
  2. Install the Cloudinary plugin from this marketplace page.
  3. In Figma, select Cloudinary from the Plugin menu to open the interface and log in.
  4. Choose a layer or artboard, then:
  5. Use the Library tab to insert images from Cloudinary into Figma.
  6. Use the Upload tab to upload images from Figma to Cloudinary.
plugins.tagline: Use Cloudinary images and videos in Figma

130782.name: Cloudinary
130782.description:
Enhance team collaboration, streamline your workflows, and leverage Cloudinary‚Äôs powerful media management features for your Figma assets.

The Cloudinary plugin integrates directly within Figma, allowing users to effortlessly insert images from the Cloudinary Media Library and upload images to Figma to share with others.


To get started:

  1. Sign up for a free Cloudinary account.
  2. Install the Cloudinary plugin from this marketplace page.
  3. In Figma, select Cloudinary from the Plugin menu to open the interface and log in.
  4. Choose a layer or artboard, then:
  5. Use the Library tab to insert images from Cloudinary into Figma.
  6. Use the Upload tab to upload images from Figma to Cloudinary.

networkAccess.reasoning: We need to access the internet to upload images to Cloudinary.

130782.tagline: Use Cloudinary images and videos in Figma

plugins.name: Sunsetter
plugins.description:
Sunsetter is useful for deprecating components before publishing the next version of your design system.


  1. Supports bulk deprecation component sets and components, whether it is made of frames or auto layouts.
  2. Also supports adding your own prefix for the deprecation. If left blank, it uses the default.
  3. Deprecations can also be reversed in bulk. If a custom prefix is used, simply use the prefix and reverse.
  4. Red overlay can be turned off from more options
  5. Add notes with collects writes down deprecation notes in a separate frame
  6. Add _ to all deprecated components without changing any prefixes, just enable in more options


For feedback, please reach out to me on @amohgs

accepted.name: Amogh Srivastava
accepted.description: I love creating things that makes making other things faster

plugins.tagline: Deprecate components in a click

125046.name: Sunsetter
125046.description:

  2. Also supports adding your own prefix for the deprecation. If left blank, it uses the default.
  3. Deprecations can also be reversed in bulk. If a custom prefix is used, simply use the prefix and reverse.
  4. Red overlay can be turned off from more options
  5. Add notes with collects writes down deprecation notes in a separate frame
  6. Add _ to all deprecated components without changing any prefixes, just enable in more options


For feedback, please reach out to me on @amohgs
125046.release_notes:
- Added dark mode support
- Add option to hide from publishing (adds underscore before name)
- Added option to create a deprecation notes
- Added option to not turn off using red overlay

plugins.name: Golden Ratio
plugins.description:
One-Click Generation, Precision Design

Automatically generates centerlines, vertical lines, and golden ratio lines for quick alignment and precise positioning. Marks layer center points to ensure symmetrical and balanced layouts.


Anchor Point Visualization, Efficient Editing

Clearly displays layer anchor points, enabling fast path adjustments and boosting vector editing efficiency.


Simple to Use, Professional and Efficient

No complex steps‚Äîgenerate guides with one click, saving time on manual calculations. Perfect for graphic design, UI design, and illustration.


Core Features

Centerlines & Vertical Lines

Golden Ratio Lines

Layer Anchor Point Display
plugins.tagline: Smart tool generates centerlines, golden ratio lines, and anchor points for precise.

plugins.name: Chartific - Create charts with your own data
plugins.description:
Chartific: Create Charts with Your Own Data

Upload CSV or JSON file then create chart with your real data, no more dummy charts!


üöÄ Why Chartific?

Say goodbye to placeholder charts and hello to data-driven design. Chartific transforms your raw data into beautiful, customizable visualizations directly in Figma:

  1. Instant Data Import: Drag and drop CSV or JSON files
  2. Real Data Visualization: Create charts with your actual data
  3. Seamless Figma Integration: Native plugin that works right in your design environment
  4. Flexible Customization: Choose your chart type, color, and data fields


üé® Features

Multiple File Formats: Import CSV and JSON files


Chart Types:

  1. Bar Charts
  2. Line Charts
  3. (More chart types coming soon!)


Color Customization:

  1. Pick any color
  2. Use existing Figma color styles
  3. Responsive Design: Charts that scale perfectly with your Figma frames


üìù How to Use

  1. Open Chartific in Figma
  2. Drag and drop your CSV or JSON file
  3. Select label and value columns
  4. Choose chart type and color
  5. Click "Create in Figma"


üîú Coming Soon

  1. Pie Charts
  2. Area Charts
  3. Advanced styling options
  4. More data visualization features!


üÜò Support & Feedback

  1. Encountered a bug? Report an Issue
  2. Questions or suggestions? Contact Us


Price: One-time $5 investment to supercharge your design workflow.

accepted.name: Trung Le
accepted.description: Trung is a designer who focus on usability & feasibility.

plugins.tagline: Upload CSV or JSON file then create chart with your real data, no more dummy charts!

plugins.name: cmd-c - Generate HTML and Tailwind code
plugins.description:
cmd-c generates HTML and Tailwind code similar to your handwritten code.


It converts both Auto Layout and Absolute Positioned (Vector-Based) UI into Flex Positioned code.


cmd-c also generates semantically correct HTML by identifying the content (e.g., p, span, img, video) and interactive elements (e.g., button, a).


Our goal at cmd-c is to create the best developer handoff tool, allowing developers to focus on building what truly matters.
plugins.tagline: AI that generates handwritten tailwind code from your Figma designs.

95404.name: cmd-c - Generate HTML and Tailwind code
95404.description:

It converts both Auto Layout and Absolute Positioned (Vector-Based) UI into Flex Positioned code.


cmd-c also generates semantically correct HTML by identifying the content (e.g., p, span, img, video) and interactive elements (e.g., button, a).


Our goal at cmd-c is to create the best developer handoff tool, allowing developers to focus on building what truly matters.
95404.release_notes: - Removed login and made the plugin more accessible.
95404.tagline: AI that generates handwritten tailwind code from your Figma designs.

plugins.name: Joy UI Theme Export
plugins.description:
This plugin exports a Joy UI theme palette by parsing the Figma variables and comparing to the default Joy UI theme. It will result in a theme object that can be copied and pasted into your code as is, and your code theme will match your Figma theme, eliminating the need for manual updating of theme values in your code.


Coming soon: Github integration to open PR's into your design system with theme changes, with the click of a button!
plugins.tagline: Export Joy UI theme with one click

plugins.name: Automator: Automate hundreds of creatives instantly.
plugins.description:
Want to create hundreds of creatives instantly? Well now you can!


Introducing Automator, a plugin built to make executing multiple creatives quick and easy.


How does it work?

Automator takes your existing creatives within Figma and applies data to that creative from a spreadsheet. You can simply drag your spreadsheet of data into Automator and it will convert that data into creatives. The only thing you need to do is make sure that your item names match the headers in your spreadsheet. The data can consist of text and images (note that images need to be served from a URL).


For best results make sure that you have you prepared your 'template' creatives in a way that work best for your data. Make sure that your text boxes are sized in a way that the new text can fit, such as keeping the box boundaries within the creative space. Automator automatically resizes the text to fit the text box, so keep that in mind when it comes to text that you don't want to be larger than a button or text that goes over an focal point of an image.
plugins.tagline: Automate hundreds of creatives instantly.

112978.name: Automator: Automate hundreds of creatives instantly.
112978.description:
Want to create hundreds of creatives instantly? Well now you can!


Introducing Automator, a plugin built to make executing multiple creatives quick and easy.


How does it work?

Automator takes your existing creatives within Figma and applies data to that creative from a spreadsheet. You can simply drag your spreadsheet of data into Automator and it will convert that data into creatives. The only thing you need to do is make sure that your item names match the headers in your spreadsheet. The data can consist of text and images (note that images need to be served from a URL).


For best results make sure that you have you prepared your 'template' creatives in a way that work best for your data. Make sure that your text boxes are sized in a way that the new text can fit, such as keeping the box boundaries within the creative space. Automator automatically resizes the text to fit the text box, so keep that in mind when it comes to text that you don't want to be larger than a button or text that goes over an focal point of an image.

plugins.name: Keywords Generator
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to the daunting task of manually creating keywords for each component. With the AI-powered Keywords Generator plugin, you can instantly generate keywords for all your components.


How it works

Under the hood, the plugin generates a list of keywords that are synonym and closely related to the component title.


How to use

  1. Enter a valid OpenAI API key and click on "Validate Key". If successful, you'll be taken to the logged area.
  2. Select all components you wish to generate keywords for the description field (make sure you select the parent components)
  3. Select the keywords amounts and language
  4. Click on ‚ÄùGenerate Keywords‚Äù and wait until you see a success alert displayed


Note

  1. Please bear in mind that this plugin leverages an AI large language model, which may generate unexpected results or hallucinations. Leave a comment if you encounter unexpected outcomes or spot bugs
  2. You'll need an OpenAI API key with credit balance in order to use this plugin. Probably you won't ever use more than $0.10 in credit
  3. The time taken to generate the keywords will vary significantly depending on the amount of components selected


Ideas & Suggestions

This is a very first version and there's a lot to improve. I‚Äôd love to hear ideas and feature suggestions to continuously improve this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generate AI-powered keywords for all your Figma components.

plugins.name: Airtable Connect
plugins.description:
The plugin allows data from Airtable to be mapped to the layers of Figma components. This functionality is especially useful for designers looking to streamline their workflow and maximize efficiency. With this plugin, it is possible to generate multiple design variations in a matter of seconds, eliminating the need for manual adjustments one by one.


By integrating Airtable with Figma, designers can import structured data directly into their design files. For example, if you have a table in Airtable with different content versions for a marketing campaign, you can assign this data to text and image elements in your Figma components. This not only saves time but also reduces the risk of errors when copying and pasting information.


Furthermore, the plugin is highly versatile and can be used in a variety of projects, from creating user interface prototypes to generating personalized graphic material. Its intuitive use does not require advanced knowledge, making it accessible to both beginner and experienced designers.


In summary, this plugin transforms the way we work with data and design, providing an efficient and effective solution for creating dynamic and adaptable designs.


https://airtable-connect.livingcrowdland.com/
plugins.tagline: The plugin maps Airtable data to Figma layers, enabling quick creation of multiple design variations

plugins.name: Fast make grid
plugins.description:
üéõÔ∏è Grid Generator

Grid Generator es una herramienta que dise√±√© para crear grillas din√°micas y bien estructuradas basadas en frameworks populares como Bootstrap y Foundation. Mi objetivo fue simplificar la configuraci√≥n de columnas, breakpoints y m√°rgenes para tus dise√±os, garantizando precisi√≥n y ahorr√°ndote tiempo.


Ya sea que est√©s trabajando en un dise√±o responsive, configurando un sistema de dise√±o o ajustando m√°rgenes precisos, Grid Generator te ofrece la flexibilidad que necesitas para que te concentres en lo importante: ¬°dise√±ar! ‚ú®


‚úÖ Soporte para Frameworks Populares

Genera grillas ajustadas a los breakpoints de:

  1. Bootstrap: Desde xs hasta xxl.
  2. Foundation: Desde small hasta xlarge.


‚úÖ Contenedores Din√°micos

Configura contenedores:

  1. Fixed: Se ajusta al ancho del breakpoint seleccionado.
  2. Fluid: Se adapta al ancho completo del frame.


‚úÖ M√°rgenes Autom√°ticos

Agrega m√°rgenes externos din√°micos en contenedores Fixed, calculados seg√∫n el framework seleccionado:

  1. Bootstrap: 12px por lado.
  2. Foundation: 16px por lado.


‚úÖ C√°lculo Preciso de Columnas

El plugin ajusta el tama√±o de las columnas autom√°ticamente seg√∫n el ancho disponible, restando m√°rgenes y gutters para garantizar una alineaci√≥n perfecta.


¬øC√≥mo usarlo?

  1. Selecciona un Frame
  2. Aseg√∫rate de tener un frame seleccionado para aplicar la grilla.
  3. Configura la Grilla
  4. Escoge un framework (Bootstrap o Foundation).
  5. Selecciona un breakpoint.
  6. Define el tipo de contenedor (Fixed o Fluid).
  7. Elige el n√∫mero de columnas (4 o 12).
  8. Haz clic en "Generar Grilla" para aplicar la configuraci√≥n al frame.


Opcional: Agregar M√°rgenes

Si el contenedor es Fixed, usa el bot√≥n "Agregar M√°rgenes" para incluir m√°rgenes externos a los extremos.


Si tienes consejos o mejoras me dejas un comentario!!!
plugins.tagline: Crea grillas rapidamente en un frame para tus dise√±os responsivos

plugins.name: Radix Colos as figma variables
plugins.description:
Here is the first version of Radix colors as Figma variables. Beta.


Radix Colors - "A gorgeous, accessible color system for user interfaces"


This plugin is a simple way for you to get any of the Radix colors as variables into a variable collection from any of your files.


The plugin allows you to:

  1. add any color to a preferred variable collection
  2. add solid or alpha variants
  3. choose light or dark values for single mode collections
  4. add both light and dark values as modes for multimode collections (Figma paid seat is required for variable modes)
  5. (soon) add a custom color created in radix web ui
  6. set-up a new variable collection with 2 modes
  7. choose your own collection where to put the variables
  8. choose your ow light and dark modes from the collection


INFO: The plugin is functional, but the user guide and error handling are not done yet. I am releasing it as i is for now so everybody can use the current feature set that covers most of the intended feature set


In order for the plugin to function, you need to go to settings and:

  1. select a mode of operation
  2. select or create a variable collection. It can be renamed at any time in the Figma UI
  3. select variable modes where the values will land. (They can also be renamed at any time)


Settings are saved as you select them.

Known bug: When you create a new collection, you need to close and reopen the settings page to reflect the changes, or press the refresh button.


This was mostly developed in coffee shops. I hope you see where i'm going with this... üòÜ


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/bogris
plugins.tagline: add Radix colors as Figma variables intou your collection

plugins.name: Variables to Xcode
plugins.description:
This plugin is used to export variables to Xcode color set.


### Usage


1. Run the plugin in Figma.

2. Select the color collection.

3. Click the export button.

4. unzip the file and copy the color set to your xcode project.

plugins.name: Perceptually Uniform Gradients
plugins.description:
By default, Figma can generate some gradients that get really muddy as they transition from color to color. With this plugin you can generate gradients using color models which handle interpolation better, which translates to more beautiful gradients.


Features:

  1. Generate gradients in Lab, OKLCH, or LCH and insert them into your Figma files as a continuous gradient or as individual, evenly-spaced stops
  2. Extract key colors from your current selection
  3. Copy raw text color scales out of the plugin in JSON format
  4. Generate multi-hue gradients
  5. Automatically correct the lightness distributions of your gradients
  6. Generate bezier-curved gradients in the Lab color space
  7. Adjust the gamma distribution of your gradients
  8. Select colors from a curated library of options
  9. Drag and drop to reorder colors
plugins.tagline: Generate more beautiful gradients by interpolating them with perceptually uniform color models.

104992.name: Perceptually Uniform Gradients
104992.description:
By default, Figma can generate some gradients that get really muddy as they transition from color to color. With this plugin you can generate gradients using color models which handle interpolation better, which translates to more beautiful gradients.


Features:

  1. Generate gradients in Lab, OKLCH, or LCH and insert them into your Figma files as a continuous gradient or as individual, evenly-spaced stops
  2. Extract key colors from your current selection
  3. Copy raw text color scales out of the plugin in JSON format
  4. Generate multi-hue gradients
  5. Automatically correct the lightness distributions of your gradients
  6. Generate bezier-curved gradients in the Lab color space
  7. Adjust the gamma distribution of your gradients
  8. Select colors from a curated library of options
  9. Drag and drop to reorder colors
104992.release_notes: Added the ability to temporarily hide key colors from the generated output.
104992.tagline: Generate more beautiful gradients by interpolating them with perceptually uniform color models.

plugins.name: Color AutoUpdater
plugins.description:
üöÄ Color AutoUpdater is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly keeping your design colors in check! Say goodbye to manually updating frame backgrounds and hello to automation.


‚ú® What it does:


üîç Scans all frames on the current page for text nodes with valid hex color codes.

üé® Updates frame backgrounds to match the detected hex color code.

üåì Ensures text readability by switching text to white on dark backgrounds and black on light backgrounds.

üßº Sets default colors (white background, black text) for frames without a color code, ensuring a clean and consistent look.


üõ†Ô∏è How to use it:


Select the Page: Open your Figma file and navigate to the page you want to update.

Automatic Update: The plugin scans all frames on the page and updates background colors based on the hex codes found in text nodes.

Review Changes: Frames with valid hex codes will have their backgrounds updated and text colors adjusted. Frames without hex codes will have a default white background and black text.


‚ö†Ô∏è Relevant limitations:


The plugin supports only 6-character hex color codes (e.g., #FFFFFF).

It works on the current page only, so run it separately for each page in your Figma file.

Frames without color codes will be set to a white background and black text, which might override custom defaults set by the user.

üí° With Color AutoUpdater, maintain a polished and consistent design effortlessly, saving you time and ensuring color accuracy and readability. Try it now and elevate your design workflow! üåü
plugins.tagline: update frame background colors based on color codes

92266.name: Color AutoUpdater
92266.description:
üöÄ Color AutoUpdater is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly keeping your design colors in check! Say goodbye to manually updating frame backgrounds and hello to automation.


‚ú® What it does:

üé® Updates frame backgrounds to match the detected hex color code.

üåì Ensures text readability by switching text to white on dark backgrounds and black on light backgrounds.

üßº Sets default colors (white background, black text) for frames without a color code, ensuring a clean and consistent look.


üõ†Ô∏è How to use it:


Select the Page: Open your Figma file and navigate to the page you want to update.

Automatic Update: The plugin scans all frames on the page and updates background colors based on the hex codes found in text nodes.

Review Changes: Frames with valid hex codes will have their backgrounds updated and text colors adjusted. Frames without hex codes will have a default white background and black text.


‚ö†Ô∏è Relevant limitations:


The plugin supports only 6-character hex color codes (e.g., #FFFFFF).

It works on the current page only, so run it separately for each page in your Figma file.

Frames without color codes will be set to a white background and black text, which might override custom defaults set by the user.

üí° With Color AutoUpdater, maintain a polished and consistent design effortlessly, saving you time and ensuring color accuracy and readability. Try it now and elevate your design workflow! üåü
92266.tagline: update frame background colors based on color codes

plugins.name: Tuned Variables
plugins.description:
Tuned Variables

A Figma plugin for creating simple mathmatical expressions with local variables


üî• Features:

  • Create values based on simple mathmatical expressions
  • Use other variables as values for an expression
  • Reference variables from other groups
  • Reference variables from other collections


üöÄ How to use:

  1. In a variable, update its description with an expression like so: {{ 2 + 2 }}
  2. In the menu bar, click on the plugin, and it will run through all your variables and update their values if an expression is set.
  3. To use other variables as values reference them like so: {{ $base * 2 }}. This will take the value from the value with the name base
  4. To use nested variables simply use their name: {{ $Font/Size/base * 2}}. This will take the value base from the group Size inside the group Font
  5. To use variables from other collections prepend the variable name with the collection name. Example: If you have a collection called primitives then write it like so $primitives/Font/Size/base - this will get the variable Font/Size/base inside the primitives collection


üöß Limitations:

Only Number variables at the moment

Modes are isolated, so you can't use a variable value from another mode.

Only simple operators are supported: *, /, +, -


üéÅ Contribute:

If you want to improve the plugin, then you are very welcome to create a PR


ü§ù License:

This will stay forever free and you are welcome to use this in personal and business use.


üíé Need more advanced featues?

I don't have plans to make this plugin more advanced, so if you need more advanced features i would recommend you to check out the Dynamic Variables by @neelts
plugins.tagline: Reference other variables and create simple calculations for dynamic values

  3. To use other variables as values reference them like so: {{ $base * 2 }}. This will take the value from the value with the name base
  4. To use nested variables simply use their name: {{ $Font/Size/base * 2}}. This will take the value base from the group Size inside the group Font
  5. To use variables from other collections prepend the variable name with the collection name. Example: If you have a collection called primitives then write it like so $primitives/Font/Size/base - this will get the variable Font/Size/base inside the primitives collection

plugins.name: Cluster Creator
plugins.description: Select a group of sticky notes or shapes with text, run the plugin, type in the text you want to grab the nodes by and click "create". The notes the contain the given text will be moved to a section with the same name as the given text. Now you can move that group of notes to wherever makes sense and rename the section if necessary.
plugins.tagline: Select sticky notes that contain your cluster key words

87984.description: Select a group of sticky notes or shapes with text, run the plugin, type in the text you want to grab the nodes by and click "create". The notes the contain the given text will be moved to a section with the same name as the given text. Now you can move that group of notes to wherever makes sense and rename the section if necessary.
87984.release_notes: Account for sticky notes that are taller than the default sticky note height
87984.tagline: Select sticky notes that contain your cluster key words

plugins.name: PromptGen
plugins.description: PromptGen automatically converts the visuals of any selected Figma frame into detailed, human-readable descriptions. Perfect for creative brainstorming, documentation, or dev workflows with tools like Cursor and Bolt, PromptGen streamlines your design-to-code handoff by letting AI generate structured prompts from your frames‚Äîwith minimal manual formatting.

plugins.name: Shadow Exporter
plugins.description: To use the plugin, select your components and click "Export." It will generate all variants of the component, organizing them into a main folder with subfolders. Each subfolder will be named after the component, and the files within will be named using the variant names.
plugins.tagline: Easily export your artwork

plugins.name: Print Frame
plugins.description:
1. A plugin to resize or generate frame in print size
  2. Step and repeat can be used to clone a frame into desired grid.
  3. Serial number generator can be used to add serial number to cloned frames.
  4. nup page can be used to layout items on to print size pages.
  5. Sync data from public google sheet into frames
plugins.tagline: A plugin to use for your print workflows
